name: Pad Pak Ruam Mitr
description:
**Spice:** 3/5
**Origin:** Thai
**Time:** Fast

## Directions
Heat vegetable oil and chile oil together in a wok or skillet over medium heat, add garlic and stir until golden brown. Add broccoli, cauliflower, shallots and water. Saute until tender, about 2 minutes, stir in all other ingredients except pepper powder. Stir fry until just cooked but still crispy. Quickly stir in spinach and remove from heat. Transfer to serving plate, sprinkle with Thai pepper powder. Serve with steamed Thai jasmine rice.

name: Bun nem
description: - Kieran has recipe in ChatGPT

name: Broccoli-Cheddar Pockets
description:
- Kosher salt
- 106 grams chopped broccoli florets
- 125 grams cups grated sharp cheddar cheese (about 5 ounces)
- 3 tablespoons sour cream
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives
- Vegetable oil, for brushing
- All-purpose flour, for dusting
- Puff pastry
- 1 large egg

## Directions

- Bring a saucepan of lightly salted water to a boil.
- Add the broccoli and cook 1 minute.
- Drain and rinse under cold water until cool; pat dry.
- Mix the broccoli, cheddar, sour cream and chives in a bowl until combined, then squeeze the mixture together with your hands to make it compact.
  \-Preheat the oven to 200C fan and brush a baking sheet lightly with vegetable oil.
- On a floured surface, roll out the dough and fill the dinner pockets:
  1\. Cut the dough into 4 pieces. Roll each piece into a 6-by-8-inch rectangle on a floured surface.
  2\. Put one-quarter of the filling in the center of each dough rectangle, pressing it together.
  3\. Fold the 2 shorter sides of the dough over the filling, stretching the dough to cover.
  4\. Fold in the 2 long sides of the dough like a burrito. Pinch the edges to seal.
- Place the pockets seam-side down on the prepared baking sheet.
- Beat the egg and 1 tablespoon water in a small bowl; brush the pockets with the egg wash.
- Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.

name: Couscous salad with chickpeas and feta

name: Mexican enchiladas (vegetarian)
description:
Ingredients
=========

For the salsa:
------------------
- 1 x 400 g tin chopped tomatoes
- 1 medium green chilli (the fat, squat variety that isn't too fiery)
- 1 medium red onion, peeled and finely chopped
- 2 heaped tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves, plus a little extra to garnish
- juice 1 lime
- salt and freshly milled black pepper

For the enchiladas:
-----------------------
- 4 large flour tortillas
- 110 g Wensleydale, grated
- 150 g Mozzarella, grated (a block of Mozzarella is best for this)
- 100 ml half-fat cr√®me fra√Æche

Method
=========
1. Pre-heat the oven to gas mark 4, 350¬∞F (180¬∞C).

2. Begin by making the salsa: first tip the tomatoes into a sieve over a bowl to let the excess liquid drain away.

3. Next remove the stalk from the chili, cut it in half, chop the flesh very finely and place it in a bowl. 
4. Then add half the chopped onion, the drained tomatoes, chopped coriander leaves and lime juice, and season well with salt and pepper. Now give everything a thorough mixing. 

5. Meanwhile, mix the 2 cheeses together in a bowl. 
6. Place one tortilla on a flat surface and spread a tablespoon of salsa over it, but not quite to the edges, sprinkle over a heaped tablespoon of the cheese mixture, then follow this with a tablespoon of the cr√®me fra√Æche.
8. Then roll the tortilla up and place it in the baking dish with the sealed-side down. Repeat this with the others, then spread the remaining cr√®me fra√Æche on top of the tortillas in the dish and sprinkle the rest of the salsa over the top, followed by the remaining cheeses and red onion.
9. Now place the dish on a high shelf of the oven for 15-20 minutes, garnish with the extra coriander and serve absolutely immediately ‚Äì if you keep them waiting they can become a bit soggy.

name: Butternut Squash Alfredo Stuffed Shells
description:
Serves 4-6

STUFFED SHELLS INGREDIENTS:

30g Panko breadcrumbs
14g (1 Tbsp.) butter, melted
8g (1 tsp.) Italian seasoning (if we have none, mix together some basil, oregano, rosemary, and thyme)
200g pasta shells (conchiglie)
5 cloves garlic, peeled (2 pressed/minced)
1 medium butternut squash, diced into 1.5cm cubes
24g (3 Tbsp.) plain flour
250ml vegetable stock
250ml low-fat milk
12 leaves (1 Tbsp.) chopped fresh sage (or 0.7g (1 tsp.) dried sage)
115g freshly-grated Parmesan cheese
4.5g salt
1g black pepper
30ml olive oil
~100g Mozzarella, shredded

METHOD
1. Preheat oven to 200¬∞C.
2. In a small bowl, stir together the Panko, melted butter, Italian seasoning and 1.5g (1/4 tsp.) salt until combined.  Set aside.
3. Peel, de-seed and dice the butternut squash into 1.5cm cubes, peel 3 garlic cloves and place both into a large mixing bowl with some olive oil until evenly coated.
4. Remove the 3 garlic cloves from the bowl, and wrap them in some tinfoil to form a pouch.
5. Spread the butternut squash out on a baking tray (you can line it with foil or baking paper if you wish) and season generously with a few pinches of salt and pepper.  
6. Put the garlic clove pouch (from step 4) on the baking tray next to the butternut squash. 
7. Bake for 20 minutes, or until the butternut squash mash easily with a fork and the garlic is soft and fragrant.
8. In the meantime, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the pasta and cook al dente (or slightly undercooked) according to package instructions. Drain.
9. Make the Alfredo sauce by heating some olive oil in a large frying over medium-high heat. Make 250ml vegetable stock in a jug.
10. Mince or press 2 garlic cloves to the pan and saut√© for one minute, stirring occasionally, until fragrant. 
11. Sprinkle the pan with 24g (3 Tbsp) of flour, and stir to combine. Saut√© for an additional minute to cook the flour, stirring occasionally.
12. Add the vegetable stock to the frying pan whisking to combine until smooth. 
13. Whisk in 250ml milk and a teaspoon of dried sage, and bring the mixture to a simmer. Allow to cook for another minute until slightly thickened.
14. Grate 115g Parmesan cheese and add to frying pan. Season with salt and pepper and stir until the cheese melted.  Reduce heat to low and simmer until ready to use.
15. Once cooked, put both the butternut squash and garlic back into the large mixing bowl along with ~250ml of the sauce and mash together until smooth.
16. In a medium baking dish (I use the glass dish), spread out ~125ml of the remaining sauce in a layer. Place the pasta shells in the dish in an even layer (if you‚Äôre feeling patient you can stuff them with the butternut filling), then top with the butternut filling. 
17. Spoon the remaining alfredo sauce evenly on top.  (Optional: if using the mozzarella, sprinkle it on top of the alfredo sauce.)  Then sprinkle the Panko mixture evenly over the top of everything.
18. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes, or until the Panko mixture is crispy and starts to turn slightly golden.  Remove and serve immediately.

name: Creamy Tomato & Roasted Veg Risotto
description:
ü•ò Ingredients

For the roasted vegetables:

1 tbsp olive oil

300g (10.5 oz) cherry tomatoes

2 medium red bell peppers

1 large courgette (zucchini)

Salt and pepper, to taste 


For the risotto:

1 tbsp olive oil

1 large red onion, diced

3 garlic cloves, minced

225g (8 oz) risotto rice (Arborio)

1 tbsp balsamic vinegar

250g (8.8 oz) passata or chopped tomatoes

250ml (1 cup) vegetable stock

Approximately 6 sun-dried tomatoes, chopped

A small bunch of fresh basil, torn

Salt and pepper, to taste

(Optional) Vegan parmesan or nutritional yeast ("nooch"), for serving 



---

üî™ Instructions

1. Roast the vegetables:

Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C (350¬∞F).

Chop the cherry tomatoes, red bell peppers, and courgette into small chunks.

Place them in a roasting tin, drizzle with 1 tbsp olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.

Toss to coat and roast for 30 minutes. 


2. Prepare the risotto:

In a large frying pan or shallow casserole dish, heat 1 tbsp olive oil over low-medium heat.

Saut√© the diced red onion for a few minutes until softened.

Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute.

Stir in the risotto rice and balsamic vinegar, cooking for about 30 seconds to coat the rice.

Begin adding the passata and vegetable stock alternately, about ¬Ω cup at a time.

Allow each addition to be absorbed before adding the next, stirring regularly.

Continue this process until the rice is tender and creamy. 


3. Finish the dish:

Stir in the chopped sun-dried tomatoes and torn basil.

Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Fold in the roasted vegetables.

If desired, top with vegan parmesan or nutritional yeast before serving. 



---

This dish is not only flavorful but also vegan and gluten-free, making it a perfect choice for a healthy weeknight meal.  For more details and tips, you can visit the original recipe on Wallflower Kitchen's website:  .

Let me know if you need any substitutions or additional tips!

name: Pumpkin Katsu Curry
description:
There‚Äôs not really a recipe for this so I advise trial and error.

You can make this with butternut squash or pumpkin.

Serves 4

Ingredients:
Sauce
1 x onion, finely chopped
2 x garlic cloves, chopped or crushed 
1 thumb size piece of ginger, peeled and chopped
2 carrots, sliced
1 vegetable stock cube
450ml boiling water 
2 tsp curry power
2 tsp garam masala
2 tsp turmeric
2 tbsp plain flour
2 tbsp soy sauce
2 tbsp honey

1/2 a pumpkin / butternut squash cut into 1cm arcs
80g Panko breadcrumbs
40g plain flour
1 x large egg plus a splash of egg white, lightly beaten
180g jasmine rice

Sauce method:
1. Heat 1tbsp sunflower oil in large saucepan on a medium heat. Add the onion and carrots until the onions are soft and starting to caramelise, about 8mins.
2. Add garlic and ginger, sizzle for another 30 secs, then stir in spices. Add 2 tbsp flour and cook for 1 min.
3. Add 450ml boiling water to a vegetable stock cube in a jug. Add to the pan gradually, stirring to prevent lumps.
4. Stir in the soy sauce and honey. Bring to the boil then simmer for 10-15mins to reduce until thickened. If you want a smoother sauce you can blitz it in a blender.
5. Whilst the sauce is simmering, make the rice according to the packet instructions. Then make the veggies.

Vegetables method:

1. Slice the pumpkin/butternut squash into 1cm circles/crescent moon shapes
2. Put breadcrumbs, flour and eggs into 3 separate bowls. Dip all the veg in the flour, followed by the eggs and then the breadcrumbs to coat evenly.
3. Put in 180¬∞C oven for 20mins
4. Heat oil in a large frying pan over a medium heat. Shallow fry vegetables in batches for 1-2mins per side, scooping out when golden and draining on kitchen roll.

Finally pour the katsu sauce over the veg and serve with rice.

name: Spicy basil rigatoni
description:
Ingredients:
350 g rigatoni
cup fresh oregano
cup fresh basil
50 g Parmesan cheese 3-6 Garlic cloves - minced 1 tbsp. chili flakes (if you like it really hot) 2 tbsp. tomato paste
300 ml heavy cream
Olive oil
Salt & Pepper
Serve with Parmesan cheese and chili flakes Instructions
* Cook the pasta ina pot of boiling salted water according to the package instructions, then drain, reserving a cupful of the cooking water. * Meanwhile, finely chop the basil and oregano. * Sizzle the garlic over medium-high heat with olive oil and add the oregano and basil. Sizzle for one minute, then add tomato paste and chili flakes then cook for 30 seconds.
* Add heavy cream and cook for another 2 minutes. Add rigatoni, pasta water (gradually), salt, parmesan, and mix.
* Mix over medium heat for about 3 minutes or until you get a smooth and creamy texture.

name: Chicken tacos
description:
**Ingredients**

- 1 large chicken breast
- 4 big tomatoes
- 2 cloves of garlic
- 2 chipotle dried chillis
- 1 tbsp oregano
- 1 tsp cumin
- 1 tsp chili powder
- 1 tbsp sriracha
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 green serrano or fresh jalape√±o pepper, sliced (don‚Äôt discard seeds unless you don‚Äôt want spice)
- 2 bay leafs

To serve:

- 8 tortillas
- Some sliced raw onion
- Salsa verde (La Coste√±a brand)
- Coriander
- Sour cream

**Chicken:**

- Vacuum seal with approx 1 tbsp olive oil, salt, pepper
- Sous vide at 65¬∞C for 1 hour (1.5 hours if frozen)
- Once cooked, shred the chicken using 2 forks

**Tinga sauce:**

In a blender, add the tomatoes, garlic, dried chilis, herbs with some salt + pepper. Pulse until smooth. Taste and adjust as necessary

In a cast iron pan, fry most of the onion (leave some for garnish) and the jalape√±o / serrano pepper

After 5 minutes:

- Add the sauce and 2 bay leafs
- Allow the sauce to thicken
- Add the shredded chicken
- Taste and season

name: Cheesy broccoli pasta bake
description:
Adapted from https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/cheesy-broccoli-pasta-bake

**Serves 2 **

**Ingredients**
140g penne
140g broccoli, cut into florets
25g butter
25g plain flour
300ml milk
1 clove garlic, finely chopped
1 tbsp wholegrain mustard
70g mature cheddar, grated
1 pinch nutmeg
1 pinch dried chili flakes
A few drops spicy chili sauce
1 tbsp breadcrumbs
Handful of chopped walnuts (optional)

**Method**
1. Pre-heat the grill
2. Cook the pasta, adding the broccoli for the final 4-5 mins and cooking until tender. Drain well.
3. Make the sauce: heat the butter in a saucepan and stir in the flour. Cook for 1 min, then gradually add the milk, stirring well between each addition. 4. Add the garlic to the sauce. Bring to the boil, stirring, then simmer for 2 mins, before stirring in the mustard, half the cheese, plus the nutmeg, chili flakes and spicy chili sauce. Season well.
5. Mix the pasta and broccoli into the sauce and spoon into an ovenproof dish. Scatter over the remaining cheese and breadcrumbs and place under a hot grill for 3-4 mins until golden and bubbling. If using, add the chopped walnuts (don't do this before the grill as they'll burn)
6. Serve in bowls. Nom nom.

name: Tom yum soup with rice noodles
Veggie Shepherds Pie with Wine instead of Meat
Dad Curry
description:
1-2 onions chopped or sliced
4 garlic cloves
1 teaspoon ginger
Half tin of toms
1 or 2 teaspoon of tomato pur√©e (if you have it)
1.5 teaspoon coriander powder
1.5 teaspoon cumin powder
.25 teaspoon turmeric
.25 teaspoon chilli powder
Some salt

Fry onions in oil or butter on a medium heat until lightly brown, then add garlic and ginger.

Fry for a couple of minutes then coriander, cumin, turmeric, chilli and some salt.

Fry for a couple of minutes then add half tin tomatoes.

Leave to cook for 5 minutes until it thickens.

Add chicken, meat or veg. Mix it all up and cover and gook for 5 minutes until the meat has browned.

Add about a cup full of water, give it a stir, cover and leave it to cook for An hour or so.¬† Make sure you stir it every 10 minutes or so. Don't let t stick at the bottom.

If its meat then cook for longer until it is tender.

If its veg, then make sure the potatoes dont overlook and fall apart.

If its too watery, take the lid off and let the liquid evaporate.¬† If its too thick, add some water.

If you want to add more flavour, instead of water, use chicken stock.

Serve garnished with chopped fresh coriander

name: Vegetarian Phad Thai
description:
Ingredients
100g (3.5oz) dry wide rice noodles
4 tablespoons oil
1 tablespoon pickled radish
1 egg
2 tablespoons crushed peanuts, halved
1/3 cup white tofu, cut into 1‚Ä≥ x 1/3‚Ä≥ x 1/3‚Ä≥ sticks
1/4 cup :garlic chives:, cut into 2‚Ä≥ long pieces
1/2 cup bean sprouts, halved
1 1/8 teaspoons chili powder (leave 1 teaspoon for garnish)
1/8 ‚Äì 1/2 cup water, just in case
1 teaspoon white sugar, for garnish
1 lime piece, for garnish
Sauce
1 tablespoon white soy sauce
1 tablespoon palm sugar
1 tablespoon tamarind paste (1/8 c tamarind pulp + 1/8 c water)
Directions
Soak the rice noodles in room temperature water for 30-45 minutes before you cook. Do not soak in hot water or your noodles will get sticky. You want them to be soft enough to bend, but still firm. When finished soaking, drain, rinse, and set aside.
Prepare the tamarind paste by squishing 1/8 cup tamarind pulp with 1/8 cup water in a small bowl with your fingers. Take out all the tamarind veins and seeds, and squish the fruit until the water turns into a thickish paste. Strain the pulp with a strainer and set aside.
Prepare the sauce by adding 1 tablespoon of that tamarind paste you just made with the soy sauce & palm sugar in a small bowl. If your palm sugar is rock hard and doesn‚Äôt dissolve, you can cut into small bits and microwave the mixture for 10 seconds or so. That should soften the sugar enough to dissolve.
Fry the tofu in hot oil until medium brown on each side. Remove from oil and set aside.
Add more oil to the pan, if necessary. Wait until the oil is hot, and ‚Äòdancing‚Äô around (look at the surface ‚Äî is the oil moving?) Add the pickled radish and fry for a few seconds to get the flavor out.
Add your noodles and stir. You may want to add about 1/8-1/4 cup water too, depending on how hot your wok is. When the noodles soften a bit, add the sauce and the 1/8 teaspoon of the chili powder (leave the rest for garnish). Mix well ‚Äî but be careful not to make a noodle mush. Try to keep the noodles separated as much as possible, covering the entire bottom of the pan. Spread them out.
Cook until the noodles are soft ‚Äî it may take a minute or two. Taste to be sure they are done. If they get too dry, you may need to add a bit more water.
When the noodles are done, push them to the side to create room for the egg. Crack the egg into the space and scramble it with your spatula and cover the bottom of the pan. Throw the noodles on top of the egg.
Add the chives, 1/2 of the peanuts and 1/2 bean sprouts. Mix well, and remove to a plate. You may get egg bits stuck to the pan. Scrape them off and eat them. I call these ‚Äòwok crispies‚Äô. You actually want to try to get them.
Garnish with the rest of the sprouts on top, a slice of lime, and a pile each of the white sugar, the rest of the peanuts and the rest of the chili powder. You can also garnish with a few uncut garlic chives and 1/4 small banana flower too.
Note:
This recipe is for one large portion of Pad Thai. If you're making more than one portion, cook them one at a time in the pan, instead of mixing all at once. If you cook too much at a time, you'll get tasteless noodle mush. Also, this dish has a very short cooking time. Make sure to measure and line up all your ingredients within arm's reach before starting to cook.

name: Black Bean Veggie Burger
description:
Website sucks so here is recipe.

## Ingredients

- 1 (16 ounce) can black beans, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 green bell pepper, cut into tiny bois (frozen is fine)
- 1/2 onion, finely chopped
- 3 cloves garlic, peeled and finely chopped
- 1/2 egg or 25ml egg white liquid 
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 tablespoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon Thai chili sauce or hot sauce
- 30g Panko bread crumbs

## Directions

- Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C), and lightly oil a baking sheet.
- In a medium bowl, mash black beans with a potato masher until thick and pasty.
- Finely chop bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Then stir into mashed beans.
- In a small bowl, stir together egg, chili powder, cumin, and chili sauce.
- Stir the egg mixture into the mashed beans. Mix in bread crumbs until the mixture is sticky and holds together. Divide mixture into four patties.
- Place patties on baking sheet, and bake about 10 minutes on each side

name: Mediterranean Vegetable Lasagne
description:
DOUBLE THE INGREDIENTS FOR THE BIG PYREX DISH.
The amount for 2 means you only get 1 layer :(

name: Grilled vegetable wraps with salsa and guacamole
description:
To make the salsa, mix the tomatoes, garlic, onion, chilli and coriander together and leave for about 30 minutes at room temperature to allow the depth of flavour to develop.

To make the guacamole, mash the avocados with the lime juice.
Add the garlic, onion, tomato, chilli and coriander and mix thoroughly to combine.

To make the quesadillas, heat a chargrill pan over a medium to high heat, add the courgette slices and peppers and grill for 10-15 minutes or until softened and chargrilled in places. Remove the griddled vegetables from the pan and cut into strips.

Spread one tablespoon each of guacamole and salsa onto four tortillas.

Divide the vegetables between the four tortillas. Wrap them up and return them to the chargrill pan for one minute on each side.

Open the quesadilla slightly to serve, garnished with coriander leaves and wedge of lime.

name: Golden Glow elixir juice
description:
## INGREDIENTS
- 2 apples, any variation ( I used fuji)
- 4 small or 2 large oranges, peel removed
- 1 lemon, peel or no peel, depending on your preference (I left the peel on but chopped off the ends)
- 2-3 inch knob of fresh ginger, peeled (adjust according to your spiciness liking)
- 2 inch knob of fresh turmeric, peeled
- 2 cups cold water
- 1 handful of ice (optional)

## INSTRUCTIONS
In a high speed blender, blend all ingredients until smooth, adding extra water if needed.

A high powered decent blender will turn this into a smooth juice. If you would rather juice the ingredients to make it even smoother, go right ahead! I like to keep all the fiber and nutrients in but juicing the ingredients is just as good.

Enjoy!

### NOTES
If you can't find fresh turmeric and need to use the powdered turmeric, use about 1/2-1 tablespoon and adjust to your liking.

name: Kale, apple, cucumber, mint, lemon juice
Nut roast
description:
CourseSide Dish
 CuisineVegetarian
 Time1 hour 10 minutes
 Prep Time30 minutes
 Cook Time40 minutes
 Total Time1 hour 10 minutes
 Servings
6
 people
 Calories443kcal
 AuthorHurryTheFoodUp


## Ingredients

110¬†g¬†cashews

110¬†g¬†peanuts¬†(roasted or spiced)

5¬†slices¬†bread¬†(whole wheat, crumbled; 5 slices = ca. 220g)

1¬†large¬†onion

3¬†tbsp¬†olive oil

2¬†eggs

2¬†cloves¬†garlic

salt and pepper to taste

50¬†ml¬†vegetable broth

1¬†tsp¬†oregano, dried

1¬†tsp¬†thyme, dried

1¬†tbsp¬†parsley, dried

1¬†tbsp¬†basil, dried

150¬†g¬†cheddar cheese¬†(mature cheddar is great)






## Instructions¬†

Preheat the oven to 180¬∞C/350F

Crush or grind the¬†nuts¬†(you can use a food processor to save time) then mix with the¬†breadcrumbs. If you don‚Äôt have all the proper equipment (we don‚Äôt) then use the end of a glass bottle crush the nuts in a plastic bowl.

Dice then fry the¬†onion¬†in plenty of¬†oil. When the onions have turned clear, add them (and all the oil!) to the mix

Add in the¬†eggs, crushed or grated¬†garlic,¬†salt,¬†pepper,¬†broth,¬†herbs¬†and grated¬†cheese.

Mix again then knead well.

Let it stand for 15 minutes.

Roll into a roll shape.

Place in baking tray and cook for 40 minutes at 180¬∞C (check it after 30 mins, you don‚Äôt want it getting too dry).

description: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TMLQFXzVLw0

name: Chicken Kebabs with Vegetable Couscous
description:
**Spice:** 1/5
**Origin:** Moroccan
**Prep time:** 30m
**Cook time:** 1h
**Servings:** 4

## Directions
### Step 1
Combine spices, 2 teaspoons salt, lemon juice and oil in a large bowl. Toss chicken to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.

### Step 2
To roast vegetables for couscous, preheat oven to 200C. Place eschalots and 1 tablespoon oil in a roasting pan and toss to coat. Roast for 10 minutes. Toss pumpkin and carrot with turmeric, 1 teaspoon salt and 1 tablespoon oil in a bowl. Add to eschalots and roast for a further 15 minutes. Add zucchinis and roast for a further 25 minutes or until vegetables are tender and starting to brown around the edges. Add chickpeas and 1 tablespoon oil and toss to combine. Return to oven and cook for a further 5 minutes or until the chickpeas are warmed through.

### Step 3
Meanwhile, to make couscous, place stock and butter in a small pan and bring to the boil. Remove from heat and stir in couscous. Cover and stand for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.
### Step 4
Preheat a chargrill pan over high heat. Thread 3 pieces of chicken onto each skewer and brush with remaining marinade in bowl. Cook skewers, in 2 batches, turning occasionally, for 7 minutes or until cooked through.
### Step 5
Using a fork, fluff couscous, then transfer to a bowl. Add remaining 2 tablespoons oil, 1 teaspoon salt, roasted vegetables, coriander, lemon zest and juice, and stir well to combine. Divide among plates. Top with kebabs and a spoonful of yoghurt. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Serve with lemon wedges.

name: Ban Xeo Vietnamese Pancakes
description:
**Spice:** 1/5
**Origin:** Vietnamese
**Prep time:** 15m
**Cook time:** 5-7m per pancake
**Servings:** 4

## Directions
1. Whisk the batter ingredients together (rice flour, butter, turmeric, salt, 175ml water, coconut milk).
2. Heat a frying or crepe pan (or a wok) to a high temperature and pour in a tablespoon of oil. When this is hot, ladle in enough of your batter to just cover the base of the pan.
3. After a few minutes, scatter the meat, onion, spring onion, the prawns and the beansprouts over half the pancake. Fold half the pancake over, pour another teaspoon or so of oil around the edge of the pancake and cover with an upturned metal bowl or a lid and cook for about 3-4 minutes, until the ingredients start to soften and the underneath of the crepe has started to turn golden and darker brown in spots.
4. While the pancake is cooking, mix together all the ingredients for the Nuoc Cham dipping sauce (4 tablespoons water, sugar, lime juice, fish sauce, chillies, garlic, flavourless oil) and whisk till the sugar dissolves. Tear the leaves from the lettuce leaving them as large as possible.
5. Drain the pancake on some kitchen paper and pop onto a plate; to eat, tear pieces of it off and wrap up in the lettuce leaves with some of the fresh herbs. Dip into the nuoc cham and enjoy.

name: Roasted chicken breast with lemony bombay potatoes
Tomato & thyme cod
description:
**Spice:** 3/5
**Time:** Medium

## Directions
Heat the oil in a frying pan, add the onion, then fry for 5-8 mins until lightly browned. Stir in the tomatoes, sugar, thyme and soy, then bring to the boil.Simmer 5 mins, then slip the cod into the sauce. Cover and gently cook for 8-10 mins until the cod flakes easily. Serve with baked or steamed potatoes.
